titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rockefeller Foundation records, Audiovisual materials FA752

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-04-01 09:34:01 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Foundation records, Audiovisual materials

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Grant related material more than 10 years old is open for research. All other audiovisual materials are open without restriction. When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of films, video and audio materials.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center recognizes that our audiovisual materials may contain problematic language and/or content.

The films, videos, and/or sound in this collection have not been altered in any way. All titles and/or content are illustrative of the creator's original vision. As such, this audiovisual collection may contain discriminatory visual and/or aural content that is representative of racial, gendered, or ableist biases.

Accompanying description, most often with creator or donor-generated language and terminology, has to this point been retained and maintained "as received" by RAC with minimal archivist intervention or augmentation.
We acknowledge these problems and aim to cultivate inclusive representation and equity by reconsidering and enhancing our description of this audiovisual material with current sensibilities.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Foundation Films

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: films.
Motion picture films produced and/or co-produced by Rockefeller Foundation.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

All inquiries to view films require advanced notice of at least 2 business days, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those that are not available in modern formats, may be restricted at the discretion of RAC.

did.unittitle: Adventure in Sardinia

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The second half of a film about the ERLAAS project in Sardinia (The first half is "The Sardinian Project"). Describes the land and people of Sardinia before the malaria eradication program - difficulties of life in villages, land defoliated, rampant disease, and so on. Introduces the ERLAAS staff, under the direction of Dr. John Loyan, and their efforts to combat the disease using DDT spray over 10,000 square miles. Produced by British Pathe Production for the Economic Cooperation Administration.

did.unittitle: Botanical Expedition to the Heart of the Aegilops

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The search for perfected strains of wheat in Greece, Lebanon, Turkey, and Egypt. Footage from Ankar University laboratories with agricultural research.

did.unittitle: Buscando Una Agricultura Mejor

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film of the Cotaxtla Experimental Station in Mexico, researching food sources such as bananas, mangoes, and pineapples. Irrigation, weeding, cross-breeding, lab work, and inspection of variant plant strands. Construction of farm buildings and specialized machinery. Farmers from across Mexico coming to Cotaxtla for training and modernization.

did.unittitle: La Ciencia Agricola Impulsa Al Noroeste

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ffilm about agricultural sciences in Mexico; new research and technologies encouraging cross-breeding, pesticides, irrigation, etc.

did.unittitle: Comentarios Sobre Asistencia Technica Cooperativa Por Su Excelencia Don Julian Rodriguez Adame, Secretario de Agricultura Y Ganadera, Republica de Mexico

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Unedited film trims from 1961 film of His Excellency Don Julian Rodrigues-Adame, Secretary of Agriculture and Livestock, Republic of Mexico, commenting on cooperative RF/Mexican farm research projects. Part of the film Harvest.

did.unittitle: Composers Performers Workshop

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Conference at the North Texas State University in Dallas, Texas (funded by a Rockefeller Foundation grant).

did.unittitle: La Cria de Pollitos

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film of scientific methods in Mexico for breeding chickens. Shows incubators, cross-breeding, sanitation methods, warming environments, etc.

did.unittitle: Dorothy Gordon Youth Forum: The Well-Being of Mankind, Part I

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interview with J.G. Harrar, Ralph Bunche, and several international Rockefeller Foundation Fellows in connection with the RF 50th anniversary, and the publication of "The Well-Being of Mankind". Questions posed: Is the RF work aiding mankind? Is the training applicable to the real world? What are the most acute needs in certain countries? What is the United Nations doing to help poverty-sticken populations?

did.unittitle: Dorothy Gordon Youth Forum: The Well-Being of Mankind, Part II

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Continuation of interview with J.G Harrar, Ralph Bunche, and several international Rockefeller Foundation Fellows in connection with the RF 50th anniversary, and the publication of "The Well-Being of Mankind". Questions: What is the role of the private foundation? How do you feel about the recently-inaugurated Peace Corps? Are the RF and other organizations making real change in the US?

did.unittitle: Dr. Eisenhower Vista Cotaxtla

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dr. Milton Eisenhower visits with RF staff at the Cotaxtla labs.

did.unittitle: Los Expertos Contestan (The Experts Answer)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Panel interviews J.G. Harrar. Film of television program in cooperation with the University of Maryland. Produced by the U.S. Information Service.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Film contains two lengthy sections where image goes to black. Commerical advertisements would have been insterted at these spots.

did.unittitle: Feeding the Billions: Tomorrow's World

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film about food sources for the future: population developments and how agriculture and the environment will have to adapt to keep up with the need. IRRI work and other scientific solutions.

did.unittitle: Forrage Ensilado

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mexican efforts to improve dairy practices: forage crops, enriched milk via experimental strains of grass, and restoring depleted lands.

did.unittitle: Harvest

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film showing agricultural experiments in Mexico, Chile, Argentina, and Columbia, but focuses on production and research in Mexico. Footage of E.J. Welhausen discussing RF experimental work, lab experiments, cross-breeding, etc. The RAC also has the unedited original footage from this production.

did.unittitle: Harvest - Work Print Reel #1: Edwin J. Wellhausen at Telpatzingo
Harvest - Work Print Reel #2: Agraria Seed Processing Plant, Palmira R2
Harvest - Work Print Reel #3: (Corn) Tepalzingo
Harvest - Work Print Reel #4: Refrigerating machinery
Harvest - Work Print Reel #5: (Corn) Corn Festival
Harvest - Work Print Reel #6: (Wheat) CIANO
Harvest - Work Print Reel #7: (Wheat) Norman Borlaug Walks
Harvest - Work Print Reel #8: (Corn in art) National School of Agriculture, Mexico
Harvest - Work Print Reel #9: Countryside and Rural and Urban Slums
Harvest - Work Print Reel #10: National University and City Scenes
Harvest - Workprint Reel #11: Mexico/Columbia Interviews
Harvest - Workprint Reel #12: Mexico Field Day, Cotaxtla Experiment Station
Harvest - Workprint Reel #13: Corn, Wheat, Rice
Harvest Workprint Reel #14: Potatoes
Harvest - Workprint Reel #15: Columbia - Rural and Urban Slums
La Herencia Del Ganadero

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film about cattle farming in La Campana, Mexico. Randers driving cattle, usage of improved grains and grasses, experimental pesticides, identification of grass seeds, and proper water systems.

did.unittitle: Horizontes: La Revolucion Verde (The Green Revolution)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The agricultural revolution in Mexico, Pakistan, India, Canada, Australia, and others. Shows Norman Borlaug receiving the Nobel Peace Prize for his related work, as well as field footage of Borlaug with farmers. Existing farming methods combined with modern techniques of fertilization, irrigation, crop rotation, and breeding methods.

did.unittitle: International Rice Research Institute

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film about new International Rice Research Institute headquarters in the Philippines, with dedication ceremonies footage showing guests John D. Rockefeller 3rd, J.G. Harrar, and Robert Chandler. Discussion of the institute's concerns and efforts, including traditional rice farming, scientific methods, fertilization, laboratory work, and more. Extensive footage of the institute grounds, laboratories, and residential quarters.

did.unittitle: International Rice Research Institute: Harvest of Energy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Study of the biological, social, and environmental effects of rice in the human diet. Includes the production of new varieties, transplant techniques, testing of herbicides, water management, traditional methodologies, and other related criteria. Brief footage of press conference with John D. Rockefeller 3rd and George Harrar of the Rockefeller Foundation and Henry T. Heald of the Ford Foundation. Filmed in cooperation with the government of the Philippines.

did.unittitle: Let's Visit the College of Veterinary Medicine, Kasetsart University, Bangkok, Thailand

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Life at the veterinary school; laboratory, patients, operations on dogs and cattle, all with support from the Rockefeller Foundation. Features Dr. Luang Chai Asvaran, director of program, plus footage from university commencement attended by the King and Queen of Thailand.

did.unittitle: A Man, His Ranch, and Merkeron (Una Ganadero, Su Rancho, U Zacate Merkeron)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film about agriculture in Mexico; Mexican dairy farmers at work, scientific approaches towards improving production, experimental lab work. Focus on fertilizing healthier grass in Merkeron.

did.unittitle: Of Men and Ideas: An Interview with J.G. Harrar

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Episode titled "Role of Foundations in Today's World". Host Richard Heffner, Channel WNDT manager, interviews J.G. Harrar, the president of the Rockefeller Foundation. Some questions: Is the phenomenon of giving strictly American? Do people within wealthy foundations play the role of God? What role do you think foundations will play in the future? What is an appropriate relationship between foundation and government policy?

did.unittitle: Mexican Agricultural Program

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Mexican Agricultural Program (MAP) is also sometimes referred to as "Mexican Agriculture" or "Experiment to Revitalize Mexican Agriculture".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "An experiment in International Cooperation between the government of Mexico and the Rockefeller Foundation": film introducing partnership between the Mexican government and the Rockefeller Foundation, and the focus of their work. Scenes of women making tortillas, Mexican corn varieties, cross-breeding plants, fight against plant disease, and experimentation with fertilizers.

did.unittitle: One Tenth of Our Nation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film produced in 1940 by the General Education Board which shows the limitations of education for the black population in the American South. History and current conditions of African Americans, from slavery and farming to special high school and college programs. Contrasting shots of impoverished villages and poor farms, with educated children learning job skills and modern training. Footage from George Washington Carver College.

did.unittitle: "Open Mind" with Dr. John H. Knowles

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Episode #0215 with Richard D. Heffner (Rutgers University) and Dr. John H. Knowles (RF).

did.unittitle: Population Ecology

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film made by Encyclopedia Britannica about the agricultural revolution and meeting the needs of a growing population. Uses lab tests with fruit flies and mice to discuss ecosystem restraints and natural population controls.

did.unittitle: Programa de Adiestramiento Agro-Pecuario Popular

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Training film about improving animal use on farms, presented by the Council of Rural Life.

did.unittitle: Promises and Progress

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Training film from the Mexican Ministry of Agriculture. Shows the interaction of RF officers with farmers and at stations. Experiments with potato production, disease-resistant seeds and cross-breeding, and preparation of soil.

did.unittitle: Proytecto Puebla, CIMMYT

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Educational film which describes the planting, fertilization, plowing, spraying, harvesting, and marketing of corn at the Puebla Project.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Foundation: Episode of The Today Show

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: J.G. Harrar and JDR 3rd being interviewed by James Daly and Maureen O'Sullivan. Part of publicity for the RF 50th anniversary and the publication of "Toward the Well-being of Mankind". Questions about JDR 3rd's personal giving as well as family legacy of philanthropy.

did.unittitle: The Sardinian Project

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This is the first half of a film which shows the campaign "Ente Regionale per la Lotta Anti-Anofelica en Sardengna (Regional Organization for the Anti-Anopheles or ERLAAS)" in Sardinia. Footage of village life, rampant malaria and its treatment with DDT spray. Produced by the Shell Oil Company. (The second half of the film is "Adventure in Sardinia").

did.unittitle: Speaking Freely: Foundations and Philanthropy

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film in two parts: J.G. Harrar, president of the RF, being interviewed by Edwin Newman on NBC. Questions: How do foundations give away money? How do you measure success? What is the RF position on giving the public correct information and avoiding propaganda?

did.unittitle: Schistosomiasis: Campaign in the Caribbean

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dr. Peter Jordan, author of "Schistosomiasis: The St Lucia Project" (Cambridge University Press; November 27, 1985), introduces the disease, its symptoms and means of infection, and the methodologies being used to research and treat the population. Laboratory work, experiments with mice, pesticide usage, construction to avoid infected areas and to make clean water available, and a series of interviews and footage exploring the assimilation of health education, methods taught to the public, and so on. Filmed by Jack Wolfgang Beck in St. Lucia.

did.unittitle: Unhooking the Hookworm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sponsors: International Health Board; Rockefeller Foundation. Production Company: Coronet Pictures. Director: George Skinner.

Educational film about the public health danger of the hookworm parasite, which causes anemia and dysentary. The film highlights the research of Charles W. Stiles, who in 1909 convinced the Rockefeller Foundation to invest in a program to fight the disease. After documenting that forty percent of school-age children in eleven southern states were afflicted, the program used public education to help eradicate the disease.

Film contains field and lab footage from the Rockefeller Foundation campaign to eradicate hookworm in the American South, showing the symptoms, diagnosis and treatment of hookworm. Includes scenes of environments where the disease exists and methods of prevention. Also includes some graphic imagery of the male and female worms and their parasitic behavior in humans.

did.unittitle: War on Mosquitoes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Produced by the Brazilian Ministry of Education and Health, showing cooperative actions with the Rockefeller Foundation to combat malaria. Presents problem of mosquitoes in Brazil and the methods of control: filling in water holes, spraying pesticides, laboratory work, mapping sites.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Poor printing. Debris in the film gate obstructs the image.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Foundation Videos

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Currently no arrangement has been given by an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: videorecordings.

did.unittitle: See Who's Here

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dr. Jacob George Harrar of the Rockefeller Foundation speaks with Dr. David Lewis from Oregon State University. Harrar discusses the origins of the Rockefeller Foundation, its history, and its programs.

did.unittitle: AIDS in Thailand (Flecken auf der Haut)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains interviews with health industry workers discussing HIV/AIDS. Footage of urban prostitution and rural Thailand communities.

did.unittitle: Norman Borlaug: Person of the Week - ABC-TV

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Aired nationally: 6:30-7:00pm on ABC-World News Tonight. Profile of American agronomist Norman Borlaug, who led initiatives worldwide that contributed to the extensive increases in agricultural production termed the Green Revolution. Borlaug was awarded multiple honors for his work, including the Nobel Peace Prize, the Presidential Medal of Freedom and the Congressional Gold Medal.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Foundation Audio

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: audio recordings.
Audio recordings of various Rockefeller Foundation lectures, talks, and/or public events.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Titles created from original tape container annotations.

did.unittitle: Remarks by Dr. Alan Gregg - Part 1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Remarks by Dr. Alan Gregg on subject of medical education and human resources in science, at a panel discussion organized by the Boston Society of Biologists.

did.unittitle: Remarks by Dr. Alan Gregg - Part 2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Remarks by Dr. Alan Gregg from record of panel discussion organized by the Boston Society of Biologists (Question and Answer period).

did.unittitle: How Healthy Are Americans

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rockefeller Foundation's Dr. John B. Grant joins Dr. Leona Baumgartner and Dr. Lester Breslow to discuss health-related topics. Discussion was broadcast as a Public Affairs presentation by CBS News, October 23, 1960.

did.unittitle: Dr. Warren Weaver Oral History - Interview number 11
did.physdesc: Sound, 4 hours and 3 minutes. The recording runs 5 hours and 18 minutes in total; the last hour and 15 minutes contains an unrelated interview.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Interviewed by Barbara Land at the Rockefeller Foundation, New York. Among other topics, Weaver discusses the Rockefeller Foundation's association with the development of the atomic bomb.
There is a transcript of this interview in the Warren Weaver papers, FA419, box 15, folder 187.

The tape (starting at 4 hours and 3 minutes) also contains a portion of a unrelated oral history interview, namely, an interview of Benjamin F. McLaurin, concerning the Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters, 1960.
Contents were originally described as Warren Weaver Interview, Parts 1 and 2, April 27 and June 1, 1961.

did.unittitle: WEVD Public Service Forum - Helping Citizens of Latin American Descent

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Community/Public Service Forum sponsored by the New York City Commission on Human Rights. Eleanor Middleton, moderator. Panelists included the Honorable Bolivar Aviles Alfaro, Consul General of Ecuador; Frances Grant; and RF fellowship recipients, Dr. [Gerhard Melnick] of Brazil, and the playwright Luis Alberto Heiremans, of Chile.

did.unittitle: Organization Anniversary: LP Record - Side 1A

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fiftieth Anniversary of the Rockefeller Foundation dinner. Remarks by J. George Harrar, John D. Rockefeller 3, and Dean Rusk.

did.unittitle: Organization Anniversary: LP Record - Side 1B

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fiftieth Anniversary of the Rockefeller Foundation dinner. Continuation of address by Dean Rusk. (Recording continuation starts at 30 seconds.)

did.unittitle: Organization Anniversary: LP Record - Side 2A

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fiftieth Anniversary of the Rockefeller Foundation dinner. Remarks by J. George Harrar, John D. Rockefeller 3, and Dean Rusk.

did.unittitle: Organization Anniversary: LP Record - Side 2B

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fiftieth Anniversary of the Rockefeller Foundation dinner. Continuation of address by Dean Rusk. This copy of the recording is missing approximately one minute of Dean Rusk's address at the start of the recording.

did.unittitle: J. George Harrar Interview with Lee Graham - WNYC Radio

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discussion of foundations and the Rockefeller Foundation in particular, in light of the 1969 congressional investigation of foundations.

did.unittitle: J. George Harrar Interview with Alan Douglas - WKYC-TV

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wide-ranging discussion of foundations and the work of the Rockefeller Foundation, in light of congressional investigation of foundations. Interview followed by call-in questions from listeners.

did.unittitle: The Stock Market Observer: George Harrar

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Interview concerning foundations in light of the congressional investigations of them.

did.unittitle: J. George Harrar Interview with Martha Deane - WOR Radio - Part 1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rockefeller Foundation programs, especially in agriculture and population; J. George Harrar's career; foundations and congressional investigations into them.

did.unittitle: J. George Harrar Interview with Martha Deane - WOR Radio - Part 2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Continuation of interview. Rockefeller Foundation programs, especially in agriculture and population; J. George Harrar's career; foundations and congressional investigations into them.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Foundation Memorial Service for Dr. Will M. Myers
J. George Harrar Interview with Greer Williams

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Williams interviewed Harrar on the topic of philanthropy, in connection with the Rockefeller Foundation's fiftieth anniversary. The interview was intended to serve as the basis for an article in the New York Times Magazine. Harrar's article, "New Ventures for Private Philanthropy," appeared in the June 9, 1963 issue of the Magazine.
A transcript of this interview is found in the Rockefeller Foundation Program and Policy records, SG 3.1 (FA112), Series 908, Box 7A, folder 86.5 (History - Greer Williams' Notes - J. G. Harrar).

did.unittitle: John H. Knowles's Wednesday Morning Officers Meeting, with Daniel Patrick Moynihan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Moynihan was the invited speaker.

The meeting discussion is found at 00:24:00 - 01:23:10. Moynihan's remarks begin around 01:23:10 and run to the end of the recording (02:32:40). The remarks and a question and answer period then continue from the beginning of recording to 00:23:59.

did.unittitle: Kenneth W. Thompson and Scarsdale High School Faculty on the Teaching of Social Studies
did.physdesc: Sound, 2 hours 17 minutes (full tape runs 3 hours 28 minutes).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Presentation to the Rockefeller Foundation. Panel composed of Scarsdale High School Social Studies teachers Judith Oxner, Werner Feig, Eric Rothschild, and Eugene Pisani. Program organized by Kenneth W. Thompson. Recording runs from 00:00 - 02:16:19.
From 02:40:23 - 03:27:35 there is also an unrelated and unidentified discussion by John H. Knowles concerning the Rockefeller Foundation's general program review and direction.

did.unittitle: Michel Oksenberg on Contemporary China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First presentation in a series of seminars for RF staff. The recording cuts off the question and answer period at the end.

did.unittitle: Conquest of Hunger Meeting

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meeting at the Rockefeller Foundation of officers and staff in the agricultural and social sciences and invited guests. Discussion focused on the socioeconomic aspects of world food production and the role of social scientists in the Conquest of Hunger effort.

did.unittitle: Continuing Education in the Humanities - Michael Novak Conference

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Participants mainly included Columbia University faculty in various disciplines and Rockefeller Foundation officers.

did.unittitle: American Music Recording Project, Discussion Meeting

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Second meeting with Howard Klein and invited guests to discuss scope and criteria for a proposed project to create a Recorded Anthology of American Music.

did.unittitle: Robert Goheen on Foundations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seminar for Rockefeller Foundation staff.

did.unittitle: James MacGregor Burns

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Recording begins in the middle of a discussion period on general topic of education and American civic understanding.

did.unittitle: Vincent P. Dole, Wednesday Morning Seminar on Drug Abuse

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discussion of narcotics addiction, medical studies, effectiveness of methadone programs, and misguidedness of repressive responses to the problem.

did.unittitle: Pluralistic Sensibilities in the Humanities - Michael Novak Conference
J. George Harrar Speaks to Rockefeller Foundation Officers about His China Tour

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes introduction by John H. Knowles. Harrar spoke at meeting of Rockefeller Foundation officers.

did.unittitle: Fr. Andrew Greeley and Michael Novak Speak to John H. Knowles and Rockefeller Foundation Officers
did.physdesc: Sound, 108 minutes. There is an audible hum in the background of the recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Address to the Wednesday morning officers' meeting.

did.unittitle: Mayor of Boston Kevin White on topic of American Cities and Urban Problems

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wednesday morning seminar? (Address to the Rockefeller Foundation staff.)

did.unittitle: Michael Novak - Seminar on the Humanities

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: John H. Knowles began the meeting by discussing the history of Rockefeller Foundation support for the Humanities and the Foundation's current review of its Humanities program, of which this seminar was one component. This seminar in particular gathered philosophers and various Rockefeller Foundation officers.

did.unittitle: Hudson Basin Project Meeting

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Project organization and planning meeting with Ralph W. Richardson and committee. Morning session not recorded - afternoon session recorded on Side 1.

did.unittitle: Aquaculture Conference - John A. Pino

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Speakers: David Wallace, Burr Steinbach, Alexander Spoehr, Barry Fisher, and Harold Goodwin. The last presentation (by Harold Goodwin) appears first on the recording. The introductory presentation by John A. Pino and the other speakers then follow (beginning at around 38 minutes).

did.unittitle: Otto Feinstein, Neighborhoods and Cities

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wednesday Morning Seminar with Otto Feinstein, Director of Urban Studies at Wayne State University. Feinstein spoke on topic of Social and Political Problems of Ethnicity in Urban Areas.

did.unittitle: James Grant of Overseas Development Council

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wednesday Morning Seminar, on topic of Developing Countries and U.S. Foreign Policy.

did.unittitle: Conference on Plant Resistance to Insect Attack

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Conference at Rockefeller Foundation offices, discussing results of foundation-sponsored research and next directions. Recording covers morning session only.

did.unittitle: Joseph Papp on Values in Contemporary Life

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wednesday seminar? Papp spoke about theater and contemporary understandings, and, in particular, about reactions to David Rabe's "In the Boom Boom Room," which was just then opening under Papp's direction at Lincoln Center Theater.

did.unittitle: Journalism and the Humanities Conference

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Foundation-initiated conference, organized by Michael Novak. The concluding session appears first on the recording (and ends at around 62 minutes). The recording of the initial, morning sessions starts at around 70 minutes.

did.unittitle: Wednesday Morning Seminar - Peter Berger on Development Policy and the Calculus of Meaning

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: John H. Knowles's Wednesday Morning Seminar. Berger was professor of Sociology at Rutgers University.

did.unittitle: Wednesday Morning Seminar - Earl O. Heady on Rural Community Development in the United States
Conference on Weather and Climate Change, Food Production, and Inter-State Conflict

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Day one of a two-day meeting at the Rockefeller Foundation. Organized by Elmore Jackson.

did.unittitle: Conference on Weather and Climate Change, Food Production, and Inter-State Conflict

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Day two of a two-day meeting at the Rockefeller Foundation. Organized by Elmore Jackson.

did.unittitle: Wednesday Morning Seminar - Program Related Investments and the Ford Foundation's Use of This Device

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arthur Trottenburg, Eamon Kelly, Paul Feinberg, and James Jordan spoke on behalf of the Ford Foundation. John H. Knowles presided.

did.unittitle: Education for Development Field Staff Meeting (Day 1, Morning Session)
did.physdesc: Sound, 4 hours 22 minutes (the recorded content runs approximately 2 hours 51 minutes; the last 90 minutes are blank).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meeting chaired by Ralph K. Davidson. John H. Knowles presented a detailed account of the Rockefeller Foundation's program review at the start of the meeting.

did.unittitle: Education for Development Field Staff Meeting (Day 1, Afternoon Session)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ralph K. Davidson chaired the meeting.

did.unittitle: Education for Development Field Staff Meeting (Day 2)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ralph K. Davidson chaired the meeting. Day 2, morning and afternoon sessions. The meeting adjourns on the recording at around 4 hours 12 minutes. The recording is silent for about 45 minutes; it then resumes at around 5 hours 1 minute with a discussion of regulations concerning scholars and foreign students, followed by presentations on Brazil and Colombia (from 5 hours 32 minutes to the end). The recording cuts off at the end, and it is not known where these presentations fell in the day's agenda.

did.unittitle: Michael P. Todaro - Conference and Bellagio Project on Higher Education for Development
Michael P. Todaro - Conference and Bellagio Project on Higher Education for Development

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Conference at the Rockefeller Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wednesday staff seminar on Implications of Global Interdependence: The World Food and Energy Situation.

did.unittitle: Robert Roosa - The International Monetary System: Past, Present, and Future

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wednesday morning staff seminar.

did.unittitle: Wednesday Morning Seminar - Gilbert White on Global Changes: Important New Areas for International Scientific Research

did.unittitle: Wednesday Morning Seminar - Dr. Marshall Shulman on Prospects for Strategic and Conventional Arms Control

did.unittitle: Bellagio Conference on Pesticides

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Future for Insecticides: Needs and Prospects. Rockefeller Foundation conference at Bellagio, April 22-27, 1974.

did.unittitle: Bellagio Conference on Pesticides

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Future for Insecticides: Needs and Prospects. Rockefeller Foundation conference at Bellagio, April 22-27, 1974.

did.unittitle: Partisan Review Conference on the State of the Humanities

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Conference cosponsored with the Rockefeller Foundation, held at the RF offices. For related materials see Rockefeller Foundation records, RG 3.2, Series 911, box 10, folder 54 (Program and Policy - Partisan Review, 1974). Note on original tape indicates "Transcribed Martin [C.?]." Conference papers by William Phillips, Steven Marcus, and Richard Poirier published in the Partisan Review, 41, no. 4 (Fall 1974).

did.unittitle: Wednesday Morning Seminar - Joel Fleishman on the Role of Humanities in Public Policy Analysis
did.physdesc: Sound, 50 minutes of recording (tape runs 3 hours 15 minutes)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The recording begins in mid-discussion. The beginning of the presentation is missing.

did.unittitle: Michael Novak Conference

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Members of the Center for Advanced Study in Religion and Science (CASIRAS), John Knowles, and others on the relating of science, humanities, and religion, and the contemporary need for a new moral framework.

did.unittitle: Sheldon Segal, Vice President for Biomedical Sciences Division of the Population Council
did.physdesc: Sound, 102 minutes recorded length (tape runs 3 hours 36 minutes)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wednesday Morning Meeting

did.unittitle: Plant Symposium - Allan C. Barnes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Exploratory meeting of Rockefeller Foundation, Ford Foundation, and Population Council representatives with a group of experts concerning the possible magnitude of conducting a global search for contraceptives in the plant world.
The recording begins with the afternoon session (concluding at 01:27:35); the initial morning session then follows from 01:28 to the end.

did.unittitle: Michael Novak, "The Cure of Souls" (Seven Theologians)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discussion on theological education, religious studies, and cultural values, with a view to possible intersections with the RF humanities program.

did.unittitle: John H. Knowles, Health Meeting - Commission on Critical Choices

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Initial Health Panel meeting.

did.unittitle: C. Fred Bergsten on Implications of Shortages and Inflation for the International System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wednesday Morning Seminar. Bergsten particularly addressed the development of contrived, not physical, shortages in international commodity markets.

did.unittitle: Antonio Carillo Flores, Secretary General of the United Nations World Population Conference, on "All Things Considered"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Interview with Susan Stamberg.

did.unittitle: Arts Program, American Music Recording Project Meeting
Report from Bucharest - The United Nations World Population Conference

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: National Public Radio program "Options," with Jeff Rosenberg.

did.unittitle: Ambassador John R. Stevenson on United Nations Law of the Sea Conference in Venezuela
did.physdesc: Sound, 81 minutes (recording runs 5 hours 26 minutes in all)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wednesday Morning Seminar. Stevenson attended the conference as Special Representative of the President.

Stevenson's talk was recorded on the same tape as (and over) a prior, undated meeting to evaluate grants made to four universities to fund research and education in environmental studies. The recording of the environmental studies discussion starts at 01:21:32 and runs to the end, 05:25:57.

did.unittitle: American Music Recording Project Meeting with Herman Krawitz; Arts Program Meeting concerning International Dance Programs

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Original label read: "Jon Rhode - Interview Art Recording Mtg - HK." The attribution to "Jon Rhode" appears to be in error. Rohde was a medical doctor and RF health sciences officer in Indonesia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Recording project report and discussion with Herman Krawitz (00:01:45 - 01:54:00). RF-sponsored discussion meeting on UNESCO cultural programs, the International Theatre Institute (ITI), international dance programs, and general support for dance (01:54:00 - end). Participants include Barbara J. Good, Rosamund Gilder, Roger Englander, and others. The recording appears to cover the afternoon meeting only.

did.unittitle: Second Rockefeller Foundation Forum on the Arts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: How Can Foundations Help the Arts? Discussion with various foundation leaders on how to interest other national and local foundations in supporting the arts.

did.unittitle: Margaret Mead on Women in Agriculture
Colin Turnbull on the Ethics of Starvation
Derek Bok and John H. Knowles Discuss Africa with Staff
Joel Colton and Elizabeth Janeway
did.physdesc: Sound, 86 minutes (recording runs 2 hours and 25 minutes in total).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wednesday Morning Meeting; discussion concerning adult learners and education.
Recording resumes (at 01:27 to end), with an unidentified (but presumably earlier) discussion meeting at the Rockefeller Foundation on Equal Opportunity programs.

did.unittitle: Dr. Virginia A. Church on Legal Education

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wednesday Morning Meeting. Dr. Church was dean of the newly established School of Law at Lewis University, in Illinois.

did.unittitle: James Hester on the United Nations University
did.physdesc: Sound, 123 minutes. (The full recording runs 140 minutes.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wednesday Morning Meeting. Hester, immediate past president of New York University, had been appointed rector (i.e., president) of the newly formed United Nations University in November 1974.
The discussion with Hester ends at 02:02:45. The tape then cuts in on a separate and unidentified discussion with Vernon Jordan (17 minutes, from 02:02:46 to the end).

did.unittitle: Eleanor Holmes Norton, Chair of the New York City Commission on Human Rights
